reviews.text: A great deal at only $55 + resort fee so close to the quarter. I walked to/from this hotel at all times of the day/night by myself, and didn't feel uncomfortable even for a second. Make sure to check out the local breakfast/lunch place on Camp St, a block towards canal that's only marked with a broken "RC Cola" sign. I went there every day for the most delicious breakfast sandwhiches ever.
reviews.title: great value, great locaction, no major problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint would be the size of the room and the lack of a functional window. To be clear, my room technically did have a window, but it just looked out into a tiny chimney-like thing, and it didn't bring any light into the room at all. I couldn't tell the weather, and I couldn't tell what time of day it was. There might as well have been no window. The hidden positive aspect to this was that it made it possible to sleep-in, hungover until the afternoon without having to be bothered by natural daylight. Your mileage my vary .....
reviews.title: Loved the Q&C

likes.disliked: — Valet parking a little pricey. We parked at another lot across the street for less.

reviews.text: I would stay here again, but I'd make sure to request a room with a window. Also, my room didn't come with an alarm clock, but Walgreens was only a few blocks away and I picked one up for $8.
reviews.title: Very Very Nice

likes.liked: — Beautiful, comfortable and a quick walk to everything

reviews.text: My husbad and I were in NOLA on Feb8-10 and stayed at Q&C hotel. We have stayed here before a couple of years ago (pre-K)
reviews.title: Heck of a deal

reviews.text: and like it very much at that time also. I cannot say enough good things about the hotel. Spotless, nice bedding and linens. We are very picky about our accomodations and I can tell you we were very pleased with this Hotel. The staff :excellent, helpful and accomodating.
reviews.title: Surprise...BEDBUGS!!!!!!!!

likes.disliked: — Bedbugs, staff, lack of house keeping staff, not clean

reviews.title: Good value and location for off season
reviews.text: You can't beat the Queen & Crescent for location, it's so close to everything downtown and the French Quarter. Parking is tricky in the area. Being from New Orleans, I know where to look for street parking, and would never pay the exorbitant rate to park in the hotel garage. I would however feel bad for those who don't want to drive around in circles and thus have no other choice!

When I arrived at the hotel there was one person behind the front desk and he was a bit swamped. Some people in front of me were requesting a different room 'cause theirs was too small. I did not have that experience! My room was really big, in fact. I was also put in the main building. Maybe I got a little better treatment due to my local ID and my patience. Anyway, the staff was really friendly. The room was clean and the bedding in particular was very good. I booked on priceline for 45 a night which is unbeatable! You can't even stay in a motel 6 for that peice anymore, and this was a nice room. the only problems I had were: 1. I put a do not disturb sign on the door but they knocked anyway; 2. the toilet backed up (but they fixed it within an hour, still it was pretty nasty) and 3. the "other charges" I was presented with upon checkout, a fee for the gym and internet and safe i beleive (none of which I used.) I think the fee was $5 per day or something and I didnt see it coming, so that was annoying. Overall though, I think this place is a good value and great location, and definitely better quality rooms and cleaner and quieter than some of the other downtown hotels such as the Ambassador or the Amerihost. I'd stay there again for that price!
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Q & C

likes.disliked: — Could not out window, it had bathroom glass (only some rooms)

reviews.text: Stayed at the Queen and Crescent Hotel on Jan 26th 2007. This hotel is in a great location. Right near the Marriott, W and Holiday Inn. 3 blocks from the Casino. 3 blocks from the French Quarter. The hotel is actually two separate buildings side by side. I stayed in the shorter one. You check in at the taller one. This was not a problem. The lobby was very nice and check-in went quick. The room was spotless. Nice size. Good bed with down comforter. The bath was a little small but had new looking sink, toilet and bath. Marble floor but shower enclosure was plastic. Bigger size TV and Nice looking furniture. One drawback was the windows were the kind in a bathroom that you can't see through. I think this is because the other building was right next to it. I would assume the rooms facing the other directions would be ok. The main reason I stayed here was the price. On the internet (bookit.com) I got a rate of $59 + tax (off-season rate). It came with free valet parking and a continental breakfast. Parking on the street can be hard to find in this area. Regardless of the rate or where you book the room everybody pays $5.95 apoon checkout. This is for the wireless internet and local and long distance phone calls, weather you use it or not. I would definitely stay here again even if the price was $100-120.
reviews.title: I Loved It!

reviews.text: Although the hotel is older (as evidenced by the peeling wallpaper and the ripped carpeting), it was so comfortable.
reviews.title: The Queen Bites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's within walking distance of everything in the French Quarter but
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Location, OK Service

likes.liked: — Old-world feel, amazing bed, proximity to the French Quarter
likes.disliked: — Lukewarm water, no working remotes, non-existent housekeeping staff

reviews.title: Deeply disappointed and negatively surprised!
reviews.text: I would like to express my opinion about staying for 6 nights in New Orleans "Queen and Crescent hotel" in December 2006. (I booked this hotel through your site).
Overall I would have evaluated staying there as "OK" if the one thing did not override all our impression.
reviews.title: False advertising on their website

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At moment of checking out we were charged additional $38.65 (what has never happened before with us during staying in many other hotels, as well with other guests). The charges were made for service which was announced by the hotel described in Additional Amenities as free, and had not been used by us at all (!)- as using a safe in the room, a fitness center ( they even don't have one on site or at least we did not see one around ), making domestic calls. Internet service was promised to be free if booking made through hotels.com (we called to hotel before booking to verify and checked with the receptionist again upon our arrival to the hotel), but, nonetheless, wireless Internet was included in charges and, even, charge for internet booking(!!) (which I assumed already was charged by hotels.com).
reviews.title: Starving

likes.liked: — cleanliness and friendliness of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not the way to make business, when they have hidden charges and fees and try to make money by using small crafty tricks, instead of openly advertising charges or including ones upfront in prices. (The manager was generous enough to give free alcohol drinks to large group of students.) Other guest also were very surprised, even shocked , upset and disappointed.
reviews.title: Will Stay Again

likes.liked: — the room in general but especially the comfy bedz

reviews.text: I will do my best to give this hotel anti- promotion. The problem is not much about money, but dishonest way to treat customers.
reviews.title: It was okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to Harrahs Casino and the French Quarter. I would definitely stay there again and would never prefer to have been closer to the center of the French Quarter due to the noise. One caveat however, is to avoid the 8th floor of the second building because its got the HVAC right above and it is loud when it kicks on.
reviews.title: Great location and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through the hotel for March 10th and 11th, 2008 at the 311 concet rate. The parking rate was SUPPOSED to be $20 and the resort fee $5.95. Upon check-in we were told the rates had been increased to $26 for valet and $6.95 for the resort. When we told the lady it was supposed to be $20 and who we talked to during the reservation, all she said was George was gone for the day and he made a mistake. Later on we went down with an emailed copy of the reservation and it was then adjusted accordingly.
reviews.title: The shower is a closet

reviews.text: The bathub in the room was the size of a very small closet and the shower itself had very little water pressure. The phone jack was sticking out of the wall with exposed wires, and only one of the two elevators was operating. If someone tried to use the stairwell an alarm went of when the doors opened. After the 311 concert ended the hotel lobby was packed with only elevator working on a night of the hotel being sold out. The stairs were only accessible starting on the second floor which could only be reached by the elevator or an outside stairwell. They wouldn't open up the stairwell claiming "it was a fire hazard."
reviews.title: Only Stay Here If You Get a Bargain

likes.disliked: — Resort fee -Basically their way of increasing the price of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had set a wake up call which was 30 minutes late and all they had said was they were too busy to call. The continental breakfast was coffee and donuts, but they never provided lids for the coffee.
reviews.title: Good times at the Queen and Crescent

reviews.text: The customer service completely sucked and if I had treated the guests at the hotels I have worked for, my job would be on the line. The only positive aspect were the bellman and valet.
reviews.title: Great first trip to NOLA

likes.disliked: — Paying $10 to park in an open, ground-level lot, although it was guarded 24/7.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the ambiance of the Queen and Crescent. Unfortunally, we were there over Spring Break for our 6rh Anniversary and were given a room with only 1 double size bed. That troubled me and they said they couldn't change us to another room because they were completely booked that weekend. We could have checked out of our room the next day and waited for another room, but that would have been more trouble than it was worth. We liked the overall style of hotel which has antique looking furniture. It is in a GREAT location as well. WE never had to take the street car or a taxi. We walked everywhere. I must also add that the Queen and Crescent is much better than the Holiday Inn French Quarter where we stayed the previous year. THe Q & C was a great value for the money. We paid $69. per night and $15 a night for parking and a $6.95 per night amentity fee (which discounted our parking from $30. per night to $15.)
reviews.title: Small Rooms but Loved the Atmsophere of the Q &C
Not a great experience!
reviews.text: Great place to stay and I also noticed a lot of families with children there so I may bring mine and go back to the Q & C!

My family and I will never stay in this hotel again! The rooms are so tiny that you have to climb over each other to maneauver around (maybe good for a single or newly married couple). The bathroom had no shelving for toiletries, everything had to be stored on the floor. The vending machine (only source of beverages) was never fully stocked. In it's favour I will say the staff were friendly but not as responsive as they could have been - the alarm clock in the room next door which was unoccupied went off every morning at 7am and kept ringing until around 9am - we would call the front desk and ask for someone to please switch it off, they assured us they would, but never did. Overall we were very dissatisfied - the hotel is very inexpensive but in retrospect I should have thrown in a few more dollars and stayed elsewhere. In fact, we cut our vacation short by one day and returned home.
reviews.title: A pretty good experience--but only stay here if you get a deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days at the beginning of April.
reviews.title: Great bargain and fantastic location! Definitely stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here's a brief synopsis of the pros and cons.
reviews.title: Great location. Good price and decent room.

likes.disliked: — small shower stall but life isn't perfect so that's ok

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Q and C for Mardi Gras in 2007. The room was very nice, though small. The staff never seemed that helpful. We were lucky and found an off-street parking space without a meter and took our chances with a ticket versus paying the inflated rates for parking through the hotel. It worked, so we only had to pay one night in the parking garage and our car was fine and never ticketed. Overall, our stay was great and we liked the hotel.
reviews.title: Not very helpful staff

likes.disliked: — The hotel staff is unhelpful and the manager lied to me about the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fast forward to present day. We wanted to return to Mardi Gras in 2009 so we called the hotel directly (for some reason, the hotel is listed as "booked" on all the major travel websites, but staff told me that there were plenty of rooms available) to check rates. The manager, George, and I had a 15 minute conversation about Mardi Gras and he quoted me a rate of $139/night. (It should be noted that he initially told me a higher price, but as we talked he lowered the price.) I told him that I'd finalize the remainder of our travel plans and call back ASAP to book the room. I called back two days later and I was quoted a price of $229/night. I informed the clerk that the manager had quoted me a much lower price, so she retrieved him. When he answered my inquiry, he quoted me $179. He then immediately changed the price to $169. I reminded him of our conversation 2 days prior and the quote of $139 (as I surely don't expect him to remember every conversation he has with everyone throughout the day) but he flat out refused to honor the price he had originally quoted me. His explanation was that the business was "supply and demand" and that they "must have had a big group book or something" though when I specifically asked about room availablity, he told me that they had plenty of rooms left (i.e. the excuse of several rooms being booked therefore driving up the price on the remaining rooms is BS).
reviews.title: Not such a good deal after all

reviews.text: Despite several minutes of logical and reasonable reasons as to why a hotel's room price does not change magically in a 2 day time frame (especially when it's for a special event like Mardi Gras in which hotel prices are set), he flat out refused to honor the price. Even though his price is lower than others in the area, I will not book this hotel no matter how many times we return to New Orleans. If you can't trust the hotel's manager on price quotes over the phone, what else will they lie to you about later?
reviews.title: Did not care for the rooms but great location.

reviews.text: Never coming back again. Promised a King room, none were available when we checked in at noon or would be later. "Reservations does not tell us that information. Sorry." Open/used shampoo/conditioner in bathroom. Not even an "I'm sorry," just "Come to the desk" as if we are inconveniencing them. seperate fee for internet, but they forgot to give us username/password, and again it seemed to bother them that we called to ask. Room is worn -- light bulbs out. Sounded like a good deal when we booked. Won't do it again.
reviews.title: Great hotel, nice location, but charges resort fee

likes.disliked: — warm, not hot, showers; mandatory resort fee surprise at check in

reviews.title: This Hotel is LITERALLY a Steal
reviews.text: We got a great rate at the last minute through hotels.com. This hotel looks great from the outside but the rooms are very small and need a lot of work. The window sill had mildew on it, the curtains were dirty, the towels were very thin and wrinkled and the room just did not seem very clean. We were promised "free valet parking" on the website but when we checked in we were told the parking lot was full but that there was a pay-to-park lot on the corner...which turned out to be cheaper than most hotel parking lots ($15.00/24 hours) but it was out on the street. On the up side, the location of this hotel is great! It is within walking distance of many restaurants and the French Quarter.

Beware! The Queen and Crescent touts itself as a boutique hotel. This is a marketing ploy! Instead it is an old run down hotel and poor customer service. When I checked in they gave me a queen size room in the building across the street. To my dismay, the room did not have any windows! I called the front desk to request a different room and no one picked up the phone. So I walked back to the front desk, waited about 10 minutes for someone to return and eventually got a different room. While this room had a window, it (like the majority of the rooms with windows) looked out onto the rooftop mechanical system of the building next door. The room was small (European small), smelled musty, the carpet was stained and paint was peeling. I set the air conditioning as low as it could go yet it remained warm and stuffy during my stay (and this was mild weather in March). Noise carried through the building. You could hear anytime someone flushed a toilet or took a shower. If you are a light sleeper, you don’t stand a chance. Like other reviewers, I had a bathmat on the first night. Never saw it again. The room had an ironing board but no iron. After asking, they delivered me one. Unfortunately, it was old and rusty and stained my white shirt.
reviews.title: Stay away!
Nightmare "hotel" in the Big Easy
reviews.text: The “business center” was a PC with a broken printer housed in the same room (or closet) as a vending machine. Out of 2 elevators, only 1 was working. So it took about 10 minutes on average to get down to the lobby.

reviews.title: great for the 5 hours we were there!
reviews.text: During my stay, I received a Fed Ex package at the front desk. While the staff signed for it, no one bothered me to inform me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They tacked on a daily mandatory “resort fee” of $6.95 that they don’t tell you about until you arrive. Seems to me if it is mandatory, they should just include it in the quoted price of the room. Can you say bait and switch?
reviews.title: Great Hotel If You Get A Good Price
Nickle and Dimes you to Death
reviews.text: After the 1st night I tried desperately to get another hotel in the area. Unfortunately, everything was booked due to a convention in town.

reviews.title: i would'nt recommend this one
reviews.text: the room was small... that i didnt mind... saturday morning when we woke up to go check out the town the hot water in the shower wasnt working. we told the girl at the front desk about the problem she rudely said "we are working on it". when we got back from lunch it still wasnt fixed. so i walked down to the front desk to find out if we were going to have to take cold showers and the guy that was there wasnt even aware of the problem. 5 hours later. needless to say i was mad. i will say that once i got to someone that actually cared to fix the problem we had hot water within about 2 hours. but the all day wait for hot water was completely unacceptable. and the lack of professionalism from the day staff at the front desk was repulsive. on top of that we we're overcharged for parking when we checked out. i will never go back to this hotel. even if its free...

I stayed at the Queen and Crescent hotel while visiting Tulane University, and stayed on after to visit JazzFest and the French Quarter. I found it a very pleasant place to stay. The rooms were on the small side, but very comfortable. My room (I stayed in the main buliding not the annex) looked out on a very quiet street. On the other hand, the area was busy enough at night so that I did not feel uncomfortable walking the three blocks to the French Quarter by myself. This was a relief, since parts of the Central Business District can be quite deserted and creepy at night. I also found the staff very agreeable and helpful, e.g. giving me information about the best way to get to JazzFest and on restaurants in the immediate area. They were also very cooperative about moving my room when the first one (directly opposite the fitness center) turned out to be too noisy.
reviews.title: A Pleasant, Convenient Place to Stay

reviews.text: The only real drawback I found was that the hotel doesn't serve breakfast. There is a nice cafe two doors down, but it is closed on weekends, and the remaining options tend to get kind of crowded. Even with that drawback, though, I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: It's quite a decent hotel
Enjoyed Our Stay
reviews.text: I read the previous reviews with interest because I recently stayed at this hotel and found it adequate.

reviews.title: no thanks!!!
reviews.text: It is a small hotel but the lobby was elegantly decorated. The room was small but clean and comfortable. I liked the Bath & body work items in the bathroom.
